content.description: Which of the following series converge?
content.question: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 10 to the n power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></math><math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1 to infinity, of, e raised to the negative n power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></math><math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 2 to the n power, and denominator n times, open parenthesis, n plus 1, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
